which includes the payment of full salary till his retirement date and Karamvir Medal to late Yashwant Pal posthumously. Chouhan said that Shri Pals wife is my sister. The entire state stands with his family.

Title: YSD distributes foods to poor in Ganjam
Article:
While the COVID-19 lockdown has created a lot of hardship to poor people like domestic workers, rickshaw pullers, construction workers, returned migrants, stranded migrants, beggars, leprosy patients and the homeless, the Youth for Social Development (YSD) has come to their support in Ganjam district.

With the support from the Azim Pemji Philanthropic Initiative, the IRDF and the PTF, the YSD is distributing dry foods with a target to feed 3,000 families in a month's time.

Each dry food basket contains 5 kg of rice, 1 kg pulse, 1 litre oil, 1 kg soya bean, spices and 1kg salt. Nearly 350 families have received the support so far.

YSD volunteers are also creating corona awareness programmes regularly. They are advising people to stay home, wash hands and maintain social distancing to remain safe from the deadly virus, informed YSD coordinator Chandan Kumar Sahu.

Title: Govt took call to procure PPE kits from new supplies: Official
Article:
During the initial days of the lockdown there were problems regarding meeting the rapidly increasing demand of the PPE kits but the Madhya Pradesh Government took instant decision and procured the PPE from new supplies as well in order to ensure its availability.

This information was given by Commissioner, public health and family welfare, Madhya Pradesh Government Faiz Ahmed Kidwai. In the initial days of the lockdown Vcare, Innovative, HLL and Pratibha Syntex were given the order to supply the PPE kits so that their increasing demands in the hospitals were fulfilled as a foremost priority. However, currently In line, Saranya surgical device company and Trident have also been given orders for supply of PPE kits so that the demand of the kits at district level is wel fulfilled. Efforts are being made at district level to manufacture PPE Kits and in this regard the contribution of Sagar district is remarkable.

Kidwai said that due to lock down the suppliers are not able to use the public transport hence the department is using its own transportation from Indore and Delhi on a continuous basis and ensuring the supply of PPE to all the Divisional headquarters. From the Divisional headquarters these PPE are immediately sent to the district. In the period from March 26 to April 19, 2020, 60750 PPE kits /long bodysuit have been distributed from Bhopal to different districts while 4658 PPE kits have been received in Indore district.

The manufacture of the PPE kits are ensured and their supply at large scale at district level in hospitals, isolation wards and quarantine centre and other important institution is being continuously ensured.

In order to defeat covid-19 it is important to break its chain and identity the infected people and provide them treatment on time.

Title: A’garh excise team assaulted by liquor mafia
Article:
A team of excise officials of the Athagarh division was assaulted by members of a liquor mafia gang during a raid on Monday night in the Athagarh area.

On a tipoff that country liquor was transported from Koranga of Athagarh and Viruda of Tigiria to Badamba at about 9 pm by two separate pickup trucks, the excise sleuths conducted the raid.

Spotting the officials, when the two trucks sped off from the spot, the team chased them by their Bolero. But about 20 members of the mafia intercepted the officials’ vehicle near Jemadeipur of Tigiria block by blocking the road with four motorcycles. Then they brutally assaulted the officials with lathis and stocks of their revolvers.

But some locals rescued the excise sleuths and rushed them to the Tigiria hospital. An FIR in this connection has been registered with police, said Tigiria PS IIC Rabindra Bhujabal.

On Tuesday, police arrested one Rabindra Jena of Jemadeipur while a hunt is on for the other absconders.

Title: Guv lauds varsities for discharging academic duties
Article:
Governor Lalji Tandon sought information about the regular education system from the Vice-Chancellors of Government universities of the State through video conference.

In the conference, he was told that universities are conducting interactive online classes, audio-video lectures and supplying study material of various subjects to the students in the State.Universities have prepared to conduct examinations from the first week of May to mid-June after the lockdown is over.

Examination results will be declared in the second week of July.Tandon lauded the universities for successfully discharging academic responsibilities under adverse circumstances. He said that during this crisis, intellectuals and students of the state have set an example before the world by making significant contributions. He said that the dedication and activeness with which information of the World Health Organization and the Department of Health has been circulated in public, is commendable and exemplary.

He told the Vice-Chancellors that they were the builders of the future of lakhs of students. He said that protection of their interests is the basic responsibility of all of us. This fact must be always kept in mind.

He said that efforts must be made to build the character of students. Focus on their intellectual development is must. Research work must be accelerated. The Governor told to make innovations and necessary preparations for employment-oriented education of students. He said that apart from regular teaching work, arrangements should be made for online availability of research and research facts.

The Governor said that the Corona crisis is big but we must not be afraid instead we must make efforts to control it. He said that we have reached the second phase, having crossed the first phase while fighting Corona. Every person is a part of this war while staying at home. He said that the whole world is looking at India with hope today.

The solution to this crisis will come out of the Indian tradition. We must infuse self-confidence and self-pride among youth and farmers. The Governor said that the Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has asked everyone to pay special attention to seven things. We all have an obligation to follow these things sincerely.

We must take special care of our elders. We must take extra care of those who have chronic disease. We must follow the instructions of the Ministry of AYUSH to increase immunity. We must take decoction and hot water.

Tandon asked the Sanskrit University to make efforts to provide the work and life sketch of the great men in the field of education, knowledge, science, philosophy, and mathematics like Sushruta, Charak, Aryabhatta, Nagarjuna, Sandipani etc. to the youth. He told to prepare texts regarding them in Sanskrit and Hindi.

Title: Two held for rape near JP hospital at BHEL ground
Article:
Two accused have been nabbed by Habibganj police who have kidnapped a 17-year-old girl near JP hospital and sexually assaulted at BHEL ground on April 18.

According to the police the minor victim was sexually assaulted after she was kidnapped in a car by the accused Abid and Shafeeq on April 18 when she had gone to JP hospital for treatment.In her complaint the victim stated that she had gone for treatment with her friend and when she reached near JP hospital the two accused came and before she could understand they pulled her inside the car and took her to BHEL ground. Shafeeq took her outside the car and raped her threatening of life while Abid remained in the car. They later left her near Mayur park. She lodged complaint with Jehangirabad police on Sunday.

The Jehangirabad police registered a zero FIR and transferred the case to Habibganj police and later a case of sexual assault and kidnapping was registered. During the investigation police arrested the two accused who went absconding with the car used in the crime.

Title: Azam trust gives Rs 2 lakh for PM CARES Fund
Article:
Maulana Mohammed Ali Jauhar Trust headed by Samajwadi Party MP from Rampur, Mohammad Azam Khan, donated Rs 2 lakh for PM CARES Fund for COVID-19.

A cheque of Rs 2 lakh was handed over to Rampur District Magistrate AK Singh by Jauhar University Vice-Chancellor Prof Sultan Mohammed Khan on Tuesday.

Azam Khan is presently lodged in Sitapur district jail along with his wife and SP MLA from Rampur Tazeen Fatma and son and former MLA Abdullah Azam, in connection with his son’s fake birth certificate case.

Azam Khan and his family are accused of obtaining fake birth certificate for Abdullah to enable him to contest from Swar assembly seat in the 2017 assembly poll.

Abdullah had defeated Nawab Kazim of Bahujan Samaj Party, Laxmi Saini of Bharatiya Janata Party and Navin Kumar of Rashtriya Lok Dal in the poll. But he was later disqualified by the Election Commission following a petition by his nearest political rival in 2017 elections.

The UP Legislative Assembly also revoked the membership of Abdullah and declared Swar Assembly seat in Rampur as vacant in February.

Over 80 cases have been registered against Azam Khan, many of which are about land encroachment by Mohammad Ali Jauhar University. Khan happens to be the Chancellor of the university.

Title: Isolate worst-hit areas, says SAD
Article:
The Shiromani Akali Dal on Tuesday asked the Punjab Government to isolate only those areas from where high number of coronavirus cases have been reported rather than declaring the entire district a containment zone.

The party said after the identification, the worst-hit areas should be declared as hotspots where the testing should be intensified. The SAD also called for the lifting of the curfew restrictions in the areas outside the hotspots to start the economic activity.

In a statement here, former minister and SAD spokesperson Daljit Singh Cheema said areas with high Covid cases should be located "geographically, and not district-wise". Only close-knit areas having high number of cases should be identified and isolated for containment, he said.

Cheema said there was an urgent need to go in for aggressive testing in hotspots following reports that several positive cases were found to be asymptomatic. "Aggressive testing is not being done on the ground despite announcements. There is an urgent need for more testing kits to make this a reality besides raising the medical infrastructure and safety standards for all frontline workers," he said.

The SAD leader stressed the need for the gradual opening up of the economy in areas from where coronavirus cases have not been reported for a stipulated time period.

The curfew is in place in Punjab till May 3 in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, which has claimed 16 lives in the state so far.

Title: Punjab Govt to cut down security of over 135 VIPs
Article:
Conducting another review of security personnel, Punjab Government has decided to cut down the security of as many 135 VIPs including IAS or PCS officers, politicians, former MLAs, former judges, among others. In all 174 Punjab police cops, posted to protect the “VIPs”, would be called back.

Aimed at maximum mobilization of police force, the withdrawals were done to “enforce and support the preventive measures taken by the state government against the spread of corona virus”.

The state Police Department has decided to “partially withdraw” the security cover of 135 VIPs or protectees on “purely temporary basis”, which would be restored after “the expiry of period of curfew in Punjab”.

A meeting of Sub-Committee on Finance on Tuesday decided that norms and expenditure on security of people, not holding public office any longer or have never held public office, would be reviewed by May 15 to decide on possible cuts on this count.

Punjab Government had already withdrew 1,300 police officers — including a significant number from the Chief Minister’s security — from the VVIP duty to strengthen the police force enforcing curfew amid the Covid-19 outbreak.

Already, the Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh had directed mobilization of maximum police force through withdrawal from security duties.

The withdrawals from the security duties were being carried out on the basis of evaluation of threat scenario, which is an ongoing process.

Most of the security persons withdrawn are either from district force or armed battalions.

Among those, whose security has been curtailed include former Union Minister Ambika Soni, SAD Rajya Sabha MP Naresh Kumar Gujral, Akali stalwart and Rajya Sabha MP Sukhdev Singh Dhindsa, former Governor Buta Singh, SAD leader Baldev Singh Mann, former MP Ranjit Singh Brahmpura, former MLA Amarpal Singh Bony Ajnala, former MLA VIrsa Singh Valtoha, former MLA Avinash Chander, among others.

Besides, the security of former Ministers Gulzar Singh Ranike, Opinderjit Kaur, Sewa Singh Sekhwan, Sohan Singh Thandal, Tota Singh, have also been pruned. Among the IAS officers are KJS Cheema, Rajat Aggarwal, Sanjay Popli, S Karuna Raju, other than retired IAS officers — DS Bains, DP Reddy, DS Guru, PS Aujla, among others.

A senior official said that it has been recommended that these cops should be deployed in their home districts “as far as practicable”.

It has also been clarified that security personnel, who are deployed on court orders, should not be withdrawn.

Notably, the security of several protected persons in the State, including the Chief Minister, has already been cut down to divert police personnel to the much-needed curfew enforcement and Covid relief duties.

Title: Yogi stresses on plasma therapy for COVID-19
Article:
|

Asking officials to work towards early introduction of plasma therapy for treating COVID-19 patients, Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that the state might soon start the therapy as its results were encouraging.

“I am told that early results of plasma therapy have shown positive results. If so, the therapy be taken forward with further study,” Yogi said during his meeting with Team 11 officials in Lucknow on Tuesday.

Research on plasma therapy is underway at two places, including King George’s Medical University in Lucknow.

The chief minister also stressed the need for pool testing of people in coronavirus affected areas. Expressing satisfaction that pool testing had started in Lucknow, Prayagraj and Agra, he said that it would help in areas where coronavirus cases were high in number.

Yogi also underlined the importance of social distancing by people in quarantine and asked the staff monitoring them to ensure it. He also instructed officials to ensure availability of oxygen and ventilators in all Level-1, Level-2, and Level-3 COVID care hospitals.

Officials informed the chief minister that emergency services in hospitals that were non-functional for several days due to coronavirus infection, had now been started in several government hospitals.

They said people had been asked to use emergency services in hospitals identified by the Health department.

“Police, medical professionals and other healthcare workers should be vigilant and protect themselves from infection. Personal protective equipment (PPE), masks and sanitisers should be made available in all hospitals as per standard,” Yogi said.

The chief minister was also informed that one crore people had downloaded Aarogya Setu app and officials had acted upon 150-200 alerts received through the app.

Yogi directed officials that students brought back from Kota be monitored through CM Helpline. He also gave special instructions to officials to ensure doorstep delivery of essential commodities during Ramzan and appealed to the people to observe sehri and roza iftar at home during the holy month.

“Strictly monitor inter-state movement of vehicles. The administration should be more vigilant on Jhansi-Lalitpur and Ghaziabad-Delhi borders,” Yogi said, asserting that lockdown had to be enforced strictly.

The chief minister was apprised of the latest status of community kitchens, doorstep delivery and foodgrain and food distribution. Officials were also asked to sanitise shelter homes and community kitchens regularly and medically screen the staff engaged there.

Yogi also reminded officials to prepare an action plan to explore new jobs for labourers who had returned to their native places from other states. He also directed nodal officers to be available on phone and listen to the problems of natives of UP in other states and leave no stone unturned to redress their grievances.

The chief minister said that in the case of a destitute’s death, the local administration should arrange for the last rites. “Also, if unfortunately some native dies in other state, his kin be taken care of by way of sustenance allowance, ration card and house under relevant schemes,” he added.

Title: Construction work on 3 expressways resumes
Article:
Work for construction of Purvanchal Expressway, Bundelkhand Expressway and Gorakhpur Link Expressway started with labourers from nearby villages being engaged by officials, signalling revival of economic activities in the state.

Additional Chief secretary and Chief Executive Officer of UP Expressways Industrial Development Authority (UPEIDA) Awanish Awasthi said that around 7,500 labourers and 1,000 others, including engineers and managerial staff, had started working for laying Purvanchal Expressway, Bundelkhand Expressway and Gorakhpur Link Expressway.

Awasthi said that 4,835 labourers were engaged in eight phases for Purvanchal Expressway, while 2,150 labourers had started working in six sections of Bundelkhand Expressway. For Gorakhpur Link Expressway, 488 workers have been hired.

He said that 42 per cent work of Purvanchal Expressway had so far been completed.

“Directions have been given to all contractors to ensure social distancing and other prescribed norms to prevent spread of coronavirus during the activity. Health check-ups of all labourers should be done on a regular basis. District magistrates have also been asked to monitor the work,} the senior official told media persons in Lucknow on Tuesday.

The work on Lucknow section of Purvanchal Expressway, however, could not be started due to the ongoing lockdown.

The 341-km-long Purvanchal Expressway is being laid by the state government with its own financial resources. A decision was taken to construct a 91-km-long Gorakhpur Link Expressway to link Gorakhpur with Purvanchal Expressway.

Staring from Chandsarai village in Lucknow, the Purvanchal Expressway would pass through Barabanki, Amethi, Sultanpur, Ayodhya, Ambedkarnagar, Azamgarh, Mau and culminate at Haidariya village in Ghazipur district.

Title: UT denizens allowed to avail services of plumbers, electricians
Article:
The Chandigarh Administration on Tuesday allowed city residents to avail services of plumbers, electricians and air conditioning mechanics in the city, declared a Covid-19 hotspot.

The decision was taken after many people made requests for the same with the city administration. “For the convenience of residents, a list of plumbers, electricians and AC mechanics has been procured and publicized. People can avail their services on payment,” Chandigarh Adviser Manoj Parida said on Tuesday.

The city has been divided into six zones and for each zone, there would be twelve mechanics or plumbers, he added. They will be given gloves, masks and sanitizers, said Parida, adding the people should avail their services only in emergency. “The list of plumbers, electricians and AC mechanics has been finalised and uploaded on our website. Please avail their services in emergency,” Parida tweeted.

Chandigarh has been declared a containment zone after the Centre announced it as a coronavirus hotspot. The city has reported 27 coronavirus cases and of them, 14 have cured of the infection.

Meanwhile, the city administration on Tuesday blocked 15 entry points to Chandigarh as a measure to check the spread of the coronavirus. Chandigarh has a total of 38 entry points of which 15 have been blocked, said Chandigarh Senior Superintendent of Police Nilambari Jagadale.

Title: With vehicles off the road, mishap deaths come down
Article:
|

With vehicles being off the roads due to the lockdown, the number of deaths in Lucknow has plummeted by almost 30 per cent and experts attribute it to a drastic reduction in road accidents and criminal activities.

What is more, even the number of emergency patients in government hospitals has reduced to half.

Top officials at King George’s Medical University Trauma Centre, which caters to emergency health services to majority of districts of eastern UP, confirmed a reduction in critical patients during the ongoing lockdown that completed 26 days on Tuesday.

Trauma Centre’s Chief Medical Superintendent Dr Santosh Kumar admitted that lesser number of critical accident patients were coming to the hospital.

“We used to get 180 to 200 cases of critical patients of road accidents daily and such cases have now reduced to a trickle. In fact, in the last couple of weeks, we did not have any road accident case which has lead to substantial reduction in number of deaths,” he said.

When asked to quantify, Dr Kumar said that deaths due to accidents had come down by 40-50 per cent in the last one month.

According to the data available with the Trauma Centre, earlier, around 8-10 persons used to die daily mostly due to accident and critical diseases, and this number has come down to 3-4 cases, that too due to critical illness.

at Dr Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital of Lucknow, the number of critical patients earlier admitted on a daily basis was 20-30, which has come down to 4-6 only.

Dr SK Pandey from RML Institute of Medical Sciences said that the reduction in trauma fatalities was primarily because vehicles were off the roads due to the nation-wide lockdown.

“Deaths are now witnessed only due to critical ailments and fatality due to road accident has been negligible,” he said.

At Sanjay Gandhi Post-Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences, the number of cases of critical patients has come down from 60-80 per day to 10-15 daily.

The claims of doctors was corroborated by Lucknow Nagar Nigam data which also claimed drastic drop in number of bodies cremated between March and April this year as compared to the corresponding period last year .

Between March 7 and April 7, 2019, the total number of bodies cremated in Lucknow was 1,132. Of this, 204 were cremated in crematorium, 550 at Bhainsa Kund and 188 at Alambagh cremation ground.

In contrast, the number of bodies cremated between March 7 and April 7, 2020 was just 836. Of this 205 were cremated in crematorium, 340 at Bhainsa Kund and 181 at Alambagh cremation ground.

Title: HP Govt extends electricity concessions to industries, consumers
Article:
Himachal Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur on Tuesday said the State Government has decided to provide various concessions to industrial, commercial including tourism sector, agriculture and other electricity consumers in the State due to outbreak of Covid-19 in the country.

In a statement, he said the payment of electricity bills raised in the month of March for the consumption of February 2020 and for the month April, 2020 for the consumption of March, 2020 had been extended upto 30th April, 2020 without levy of late payment surcharge. He said bills for the consumption of electricity of April would be raised in May and will be payable upto 31st May, 2020 without any late payment surcharge.

Thakur said the payment of demand charges in respect of industrial, commercial and agriculture consumers for electricity consumption of April, 2020 would be billed in May, 2020 and for the consumption of May, 2020 to be billed in June, 2020 has been deferred till 30th June, 2020 and these charges would be recovered in three equal instalments during the months of July, August and September, 2020.

The CM said a rebate of one percent subject to maximum of Rs 10,000 will be available for industrial, commercial and agriculture consumers who will pay the bills on or before 31st May, 2020 for the consumption of April, 2020 will be billed in May, 2020 and payment of bill on or before due date for consumption of May, 2020 will be billed in June, 2020.

He said that Himachal Pradesh State Electricity Board Limited will ensure continuity of power supply to all consumers and no disconnection will be made till 31st May, 2020 due to non-recovery of electricity bills and late payment surcharge.

Thakur said that these concessions would help the electricity consumers of the State to meet with the economic hardships being faced by them due to Covid-19 pandemic.

GOVT CONCERNED ABOUT SAFETY OF SNITARY WORKERS, SAYS CM

Addressing the sanitary workers of Shimla Municipal Corporation, Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur said sanitary workers were playing a major role in ensuring proper sanitation and hygiene in wake of the corona pandemic and thus helping the State in its fight against this virus effectively. Thakur said the State Government was concerned about the safety and welfare of the sanitary workers and would provide them all necessary safety equipments such as masks, gloves, etc. He said in case of the death of frontline workers such as doctors, nurses, police personnel, Asha workers, Anganwadi and sanitation workers engaged in providing essential services in the fight against Covid-19, the State Government would provide Rs 50 lakh ex-gratia to the next of their kin.

CM URGED LS SPEAKER TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO HIMACHALIS STRANDED IN RAJASTHAN

Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur urged the Speaker, Lok Sabha and MP from Rajasthan Om Birla to intervene in the matter regarding students of Himachal Pradesh stranded in Kota and other parts of the Rajasthan. In a letter written to the Speaker, Chief Minister said that in wake of corona pandemic, thousands of people including students and labourers were stranded in different parts of the country due to imposition of lockdown. He said that hundreds of students belonging to Himachal Pradesh were undergoing various coaching courses at Kota in Rajasthan and the State Government was receiving SOS calls from their parents. He requested the Speaker to ensure proper care, boarding, lodging, health and emotional care support to these stranded students of Himachal Pradesh, so that the concerns of their parents could be addressed.

HIMACHAL IMPLEMENTING VARIOUS SCHEMES

Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur said here today that Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojna was being implemented in the State effectively in the wake of corona pandemic and targeted groups have received much needed relief.

He said that Government of India has given insurance cover of Rs 50 lakh to the health personnel engaged in combating Covid-19. He said that the State Government has decided to give ex-gratia of Rs 50 lakh to all the frontline workers of other departments engaged directly in fighting Covid-19. He said that Government of India will deposit Rs 2000 in the bank accounts of 868915 farmers identified under Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojna, by spending an amount of Rs 173 crore.

Thakur said that Rs 500 as ex-gratia was being credited every month for next three months into the accounts of women account holders under Pradhan Mantri Jan-Dhan Yojna. He said under this, so far 590306 beneficiaries have been benefitted by providing Rs 29.5 crore. He said that State Government had also started paying of Rs 2000 to workers in March and April for their wage loss registered under H.P. Building and other Construction Workers Welfare Board. So far under this, 75601 workers had been benefitted by spending Rs 15.12 crore. He said that several MGNREGA workers would be benefitted through HP Buildings and Construction Workers Welfare Board. Chief Minister said that the State Government has also provided enhanced social security pension to 569058 beneficiaries on which an amount of Rs 217.85 crore had been spent.

CM THANKS PRESIDENT

The Chief Minister has thanked the President of India Ram Nath Kovind for providing two thousand N-95 surgical masks for medical fraternity of the State.

In a letter written to the Rashtrapati Bhawan, Thakur said this gesture of the President to express his solidarity with the health professionals would go a long way in motivating the corona warriors to fight this pandemic with greater zeal and dedication.

Title: Apply online & start operations, Punjab asks eligible industries
Article:
Punjab Government on Tuesday asked the industrial units, which wanted to start operations subject to the compliance of Standard Operating Procedure mentioned under the new guidelines issued by the Home Affairs and Justice Department, to apply online on Industries and Commerce Department’s site and start operations.

Informing this, the state Industries and Commerce Minister Sunder Sham Arora said that a dedicated link — https://pbindustries.gov.in/static/covidIndustryPermission — has been created to facilitate the operationalization during curfew period. The concerned General Managers of District Industries Centres have been authorized by respective Deputy Commissioners to issue the permissions.

It may be recalled that in accordance with the guidelines issued by Union Ministry of Home on April 15, 2020, subsequent orders were issued by Punjab’s Home Affairs and Justice Department on April 18, 2020, allowing certain industrial units to function subject to compliance of Standard Operating Procedure mentioned under the aforesaid guidelines.

The provision of permission for construction activities to be granted by General Manager, District Industries Centre, wherever authorized by Deputy Commissioners is also available through this portal. The provision of SMS alert to investor at the time of submission and approval of application has also been made in the above portal.

Online facility shall reduce time in obtaining required permissions and also dispense with physical visits to offices for obtaining such permissions, the Minister added.

PUNJAB SPEAKER SEEKS MONETARY RELIEF, HEALTH INFRASTRUCTURE TO FIGHT COVID-19

Punjab Vidhan Sabha Speaker Rana KP Singh, participating in the video conference meeting of presiding officers of All India Legislative Bodies on Tuesday, sought monetary relief and required health infrastructure including test kits for the State to fight against the deadly Covid-19 pandemic.

He also urged the Lok Sabha Speaker to impress upon the Central Government to provide extra financial support and health infrastructural help to Punjab particularly to win the battle against the pandemic.

Speaker also raised the issue of safe transit of Punjabi pilgrims stuck in Maharashtra, who had gone to pay their obeisance at Takht Hazur Sahib (Nanded Sahib).

During the discussion, it has been decided that a control room in each Legislative Body would be set up to coordinate with each other for any kind of help regarding Covid-19 including safety of students or people stranded in other states due to lockdown or curfew.

Similar control room will also be set up in Lok Sabha (Parliament) to coordinate with State Assembly control rooms.

PUNJAB STARTS MENTAL HEALTH AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT THROUGH TELE-COUNSELLING

Punjab Government has started mental health and emotional support to its citizens through tele-counselling service, which is now available through ‘Connect to a Doctor’ feature of COVA app or via State Helpline no 1800-180-4104.

People in need of counseling services can approach the helpline number through ‘Connect to a Doctor’ option in COVA app or by calling directly at State Helpline No 1800-180-4104 established by Department of Governance Reforms.

Title: UP gives 3-mth interest waiver for industrial, institutional borrowers
Article:
The Uttar Pradesh government has announced three-month interest waiver for all commercial, industrial and institutional borrowers.

For availing this benefit, the borrowers will have to make online application to the industrial development authorities.

Industries Minister Satish Mahana said here on Tuesday that the three months’ interest from March 22 to June 30 for the three categories of borrowers would be waived due to the nation-wide lockdown. He said the industries department had issued orders in this regard to the industrial development authorities.

The orders have been issued to Greater New Okhla Industrial Development Authority, NOIDA, Yamuna Expressway Authority, UPCEDA, Gorakhpur Industrial Development Authority, Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor. The minister said the industrial authorities had been directed that if the industrial units cleared their dues by June 30, then no interest would be charged from them for the period of March 22 to June 30.

If the industrial units fail to clear their dues by June 30, they will not qualify to avail this benefit.

Due to the lockdown NOIDA, Greater NOIDA and Yamuna Expressway Authority have already suspended the recovery of lease rent and water charges.

Mahana said the economic activities at the global level had come to a grinding halt following the lockdown imposed to contain the spread of the COVID-19. He said though the government had permitted many industrial units to resume production, the lockdown had caused huge financial crisis for the industries so the government had decided to give three-month interest waiver on the outstanding loans.

The minister said the interest waiver would provide some relief to the industrial units of the state and they would soon resume the normal industrial activity as per the guidelines announced by the Central and the state government.

Title: Domestic crimes peak during lockdown
Article:
|

Even as cases of heinous crime have plummeted due to the ongoing lockdown, domestic crimes have suddenly witnessed a spike. In this course, three sensational murders were reported from Sitapur, Ghazipur and Kanpur Dehat on Tuesday.

In Sitapur, a woman and her two children were found murdered in Bhagwanpurgrant hamlet and the assailant tried to conceal the crime by trying to burn their bodies.

As per reports, Rajni and her two children, Parvesh and Vikas, were found dead with their bodies badly charred outside their room in an open courtyard. Rajni’s husband Sunderlal was away in the field and was later informed about the incident by neighbours who also intimated the police about the deaths.

During investigation, the cops noticed that Rajni’s tongue was protruding and she had injury marks pointing towards possible strangulation. Similarly the right hand of her younger son was severed and found lying away from his body.

It also surfaced that it was Sunderlal’s second marriage. While Sunderlal’s first wife died, Rajni left her husband and married him.

Later, the police picked up Sunderlal and quizzed him during which he said that Rajni was forcing him to withdraw money from her Jan Dhan account on Tuesday. He refused and instead asked her to come with him to work in the field.

Meanwhile, Rajni’s father said that Sunderlal was having a dispute with his sister-in-law and it might have led to the killing of his daughter and her two sons.

A case was registered and a probe was on.

In Ghazipur, Gudiya Devi (23) of Rajela hamlet of Mohamedabad was strangled to death on Tuesday morning. The killer dumped the body under cattle fodder to conceal the crime and escaped.

Gudiya was married to Surjeet of Newada hamlet of Bareilly. A few days after the marriage, Gudiya left her husband and went to live with Surjeet’s younger brother Ajay. About two months back, Gudiya and Ajay came to live at her father’s house in Ghazipur.

On Tuesday morning, Jiyut, his wife and two daughters left home to work in the fields in Siwan. Besides Gudiya, Ajay and Jiyut’s two minor daughters remained home.

Soon Ajay gave them money to go out and buy sweets. When Jiyut returned from the field in the afternoon, he found Gudiya and Ajay missing. On searching his house, he recovered Gudiya’s body from under a fodder dump.

A case was registered and a hunt for Ajay was launched.

In Kanpur Dehat, an ex-Armyman hacked his wife to death in Satti area of Mahkapur on Tuesday.

As per reports, Tara Devi (38) had a dispute with her husband Ram Naresh, who left a job in the Army and was engaged in farming in his native village. The dispute took an ugly turn on Tuesday morning when Ram Naresh hacked his wife and escaped. His nephew Akash, after hearing Tara Devi’;s screams, took her to a community health centre where doctors pronounced her dead upon arrival.

Later, the victim’s brother Ramesh of Harhara Bhognipur lodged a report against Ram Naresh and his two brothers, Keshpal and Ravindra in this connection and a hunt was launched to trace the accused.

Title: IN BRIEF
Article:
MP writes to PM for safe return of Indians

Chandigarh: Expressing serious concern over plight of Punjabis in Australia and other countries, AAP’s Punjab president and Sangrur MP Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday sought Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s intervention in the matter to secure safe return of stranded nationals of Indian origin by pressing into service rescue flight to ferry them home amid the national lockdown. “A large number of people from Punjab, who had gone to Australia on visitor or tourist visa to see their wards studying there, while others had gone to seek medical advice, got stuck after the outbreak of corona pandemic, which was followed by a national lockdown leading to cancellation of international flights,” he said.

Khalsa Aid member dies in road accident

Bathinda: A young member of international humanitarian relief charity group — Khalsa Aid —Inderjit Singh on Tuesday died in a road accident near Bajakhana on Bathinda-Faridkot national highway. Hailing from Dehradun in Uttrakhand, Inderjit along with Jagpreet Singh was going towards Bathinda in a jeep to distribute Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) kits and masks among the doctors, health workers and cops when the jeep hit the road divider. Both sustained injuries and were taken to a private hospital at Bathinda where Inderjit breathed his last.

MP reviews situation in Anandpur Sahib

Rupnagar: Congress’ MP from Sri Anandpur Sahib Manish Tewari on Tuesday reviewed the overall situation in his constituency and contacted the Deputy Commissioners of Rupnagar, Mohali, Nawanshahar, and Hoshiarpur. He also reviewed wheat procurement arrangements. Tewari said that Punjab Government was procuring wheat from farmers, despite adverse conditions created due to corona and during this time their interests were being taken full care of. He appealed to people to avoid rumors.

PMB’s Scr resolves 2046 tele-complaints

Chandigarh: Ensuring prompt redressal of complaints and issues regarding wheat procurement, Punjab Mandi Board’s (PMB) State Control Room has effectively resolved 2046 telephonic complaints or issues related to wheat procurement out of total 2257 received so far to the satisfaction of farmers while remaining are in pipeline. As many as 14 queries or complaints received through email have also been sorted out till April 20, said the state Additional Chief Secretary Development Viswajeet Khanna, adding that officers deployed at State Control Room were working round the clock to instantly address the issues of farmers and arhtiyas.

Van Mittras to look after 73L saplings

Chandigarh: Punjab Rural Development and Panchayats Department has initiated the process of taking over of 73 lakh samplings planted across State on the occasion of 550th prakash purb of Guru Nanak Dev and have engaged 21,000 MNREGA workers as ‘Van Mittars’ which would be now looking after them. Minister in-charge Tript Rajinder Singh Bajwa said that this has been primarily done to engage MNREGA workers constructively in these pressing times thereby ensuring a fixed remuneration to them.

Tele-conferencing to begin at PGIMER

Chandigarh: Keeping in view patients’ interests, PGIMER has decided to start tele-cardiology consultation and teleconferencing. It should be ensured that follow up patients take tele-consultation on their respective OPD days only, said an official spokesperson. In view of global Covid-19 pandemic, many of cardiac patients are not able to seek cardiologist consultations and follow up as all OPD are closed in the PGIMER. Under the arrangement, all faculty members and senior residents will be available on their respective OPD days according to OPD schedule.

Title: Video of policeman caning SI goes viral, suspended
Article:
Hectic duty during lockdown forced two police personnel to come to a head in Sitapur on Tuesday morning. A video of the incident also went viral after which the district police chief of Sitapur suspended the head constable involved in the assault.

As per reports, a team from Kotwali police station in Sitapur was deployed on barrier duty near court compound in Sidhauli on Tuesday morning. The situation took an ugly turn when Sub-Inspector Ramesh Chauhan and head constable Ramasrey Yadav suddenly came to a head. While Chauhan alleged that Yadav hit him with a cane after being asked to remain alert on duty, the head constable claimed that he was on duty when Chauhan came and suddenly started abusing him.

Yadav further alleged that Chauhan also bundled him in a police jeep and took him for medical examination, accusing him of being drunk on duty.

A video showing the head constable hitting the sub-inspector with a cane and being restrained by his colleagues soon found its way to the social media.

A case was later registered against head constable Yadav with Kotwali police station by Chauhan.

The office of the superintendent of police of Sitapur confirmed that a report from Station House Officer of Kotwali police station was sought in this regard and on basis of the findings, head constable Ramasrey Yadav was suspended.

Title: Banking with social distancing in Haryana
Article:
To ensure social distancing amongst the customers and to avoid rush at bank branches, Haryana Finance Department has devised a website to help the customers to visit bank branches during the time-slot as per their convenience.

Haryana Chief Minister, Mahohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday launched the website/web based URL (http://bankslot.haryana.gov.in) which will facilitate the customers to visit bank branches as per time-slot selected by them and also to get the service of cash delivery at home through Post office by using Postal Bank Service, thereby maintaining social distancing and at the same time quality service delivery.

The website is user-friendly and the same can be used by customers using internet in smart-phone or through computer, officials said.

The features of the application are Book Your Bank Slot and Cash Delivery at Home by Postal Bank Service. The citizen can enter / search IFSC CODE of the branch and select date and slot for visiting the bank branch. After successfully booking the slot, the citizen can download the receipt of the same. The citizen can enter required details by entering his address / Pin code and place a request to withdraw amount from the Aadhaar Linked Account with minimum amount of Rs 1000 up to a limit of Rs 10,000. After successfully filling in the details, citizen can also download the receipt. The Post Office will contact the citizen and facilitate delivery of cash at home.

The application has been developed by Department of Information Technology, Electronics and Communication, Government of Haryana (DITECH).

Title: CM writes to Shah, seeks interim compensation
Article:
Pointing to the alarming resource gap between the state’s anticipated receipt and committed expenditure, Punjab Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh on Tuesday demanding interim compensation to the tune of Rs 3000 crore for the month of April on account of the Covid-19 national disaster, along with immediate release of Rs 4,400 crore of pending GST arrears.

Capt Amarinder, in a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, asked for expediting the release of the state’s GST arrears of Rs 4400 crore for the last four months, to help the State overcome its resource constraint.

Citing the lockdown that had substantial fiscal consequences for all states, Capt Amarinder said that the Central Government should compensate Punjab for its loss of revenue due to Covid-19.

“While Rs 3000 crore for April was an estimate, detailed assessment of loss and requirement of funds for relief and rehabilitation will be submitted in due course.

However, the Centre should provide interim assistance so that fight against Covid-19 is not allowed to weaken in any way,” he said.

The Chief Minister said that Punjab was facing a huge stress on State exchequer on account of required health and relief measures that are being continuously scaled up, “with hardly any revenue receipts accruing to the State during these days due to near complete shutdown of trade, business and industry”.

The state government had made a provision of revenue receipts of Rs 3,360 crore for April 2020 in the State Budget 2020-21, including GST – Rs 1,322 crore; VAT on Petroleum products – Rs 465 crore; State Excise Revenue – Rs 521 crore, Motor Vehicle Tax – Rs 198 crore; Electricity Duty – Rs 243 crore, Stamp duty – Rs 219 crore, and Non-tax revenue – Rs 392 crore.

“However, these receipts are expected to decline sharply as most economic activities in the State remain closed on account of lockdown.

The receipts on account of SGST, IGST, VAT, Excise, Stamp Duty and Motor Vehicle Taxes are almost negligible and reduced electricity consumption has resulted in a drop of 60 percent of expected revenue from electricity duty during April 2020,” he noted.

He added, “In addition, the GST compensation of approximately Rs 4,400 crore for the last four months – from December 2019 to March 2020 – was also pending for disbursement by the Union Government.”

On the other hand, he pointed out that state’s committed expenditure, that is debt servicing, pensions, salaries, relief measures for Covid-19, healthcare and infrastructure etc, is budgeted at Rs 7,301 crore for the month of April 2020, resulting in huge resource gap between the anticipated receipts and committed expenditure.

Title: Treated Covid-19 Punjab Police SI wants to rejoin duty
Article:
Tested positive for Covid-19, Punjab Police Sub-Inspector Arshpreet Kaur Grewal on Tuesday urged the police personnel to stay strong and take precautionary measures, while expressing her desire to join the duty after recovering from deadly virus.

“I want to say that I am alright and will soon join my duty after being cured,” said Grewal, in a motivational video message, which is going viral in the social media and has earned the praise of state DGP Dinkar Gupta, beside many others, who also shared her video clip from his official Twitter handle. Grewal, 27-year-old Station House Officer of Basti Jodhewal police station in Ludhiana, had contracted the disease after coming in contact with ACP Anil Kohli, who succumbed to the infection on April 18. Grewal had tested positive for coronavirus on April 17.

In her message to the police personnel, she said, “I want to give a message to the police force that they should stay strong. We will win the fight against Covid-19”, while asking them to take precautionary measures while on duty.

“Wash your hands regularly, wear mask and use sanitisers. Also take care of your diet. You do not have to skip your meal. Have healthy food and take proper rest,” she advised in the video message.

The SHO also urged the people to stay indoors. “Stay home, stay safe. Your lives are precious,” she said.

Grewal also prayed for speedy recovery of Assistant Sub-Inspector Sukhdev Singh and the late ACP Kohli’s driver and constable Prabhjot Singh, who also contracted coronavirus. Expressing grief over the ACP's death, Grewal said that she had learnt a lot from him. “His death is a loss to the entire Punjab Police," she said.

DGP Gupta, in his tweet, said: “Am absolutely amazed @ how our young Sub-Inspector Arshpreet, SHO Jodhewal, Ludhiana, is coping with the coronavirus. All of 27 yrs and yet so brave, mature & inspiring. She's raring to get back to her work. Listen to her to find out what's she made of!”

Meanwhile, a video of constable Prabhjot Singh doing push-ups in a Ferozepur hospital was shared widely on social media.

Title: Drones to keep eye on Mhow containment areas
Article:
Drone cameras will keep eyes on all the containment areas of Mhow cantonment area.

There are around 5 containment areas in Mhow that includes taal mohalla, kirvani mohalla, khan colony, tin gali maszid area ,and main street mhow.

IG Indore range Vivek Sharma today reached Mhow and ordered the deployment of one company of QRF from SAF headquarter Indore and 15 traffic policemen from Indore.

ASP Mhow Dharamraj Meena briefed IG Vivek Sharma about the containment areas, deployment of police force ,routine flag march held in Mhow and action on offenders of law during curfew.

Around 12 people are Corona Kovid 19 positive in Mhow including 4 Jamatis who were caught from tin gali maszid.

SDM Mhow Abhilash Mishra Tehsildar Dhirendra Parashar, Reetesh Joshi SDOP Vinod Sharma TI Mhow Abhay Nema TI Kishanganj Sashikant Chourasia TI Badgonda Lalit Sikarwar were also present

Title: Rate of doubling of coronavirus cases in Hry 2 weeks: Vij
Article:
Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij on Tuesday said that the rate at which the number of coronavirus cases in Haryana was doubling is 13.15 days as against the national average of 7.5 days.

The reports of Union Health Ministry revealed that the rate at which the number of corona virus cases in the country was doubling in the last one week has slowed to 7.5 days, as against 3.4 days before the nationwide lockdown was imposed. Vij tweeted, “Doubling of #Covid-19 cases in Haryana is in 13.15 days as against 7.5 days in the country.” He also said that Haryana was fast moving towards normalcy. “With 56.7 per cent recovery rate against 16.38 per cent of all India rate of #coronavirus cases, Haryana is moving fast towards normalcy,” he said.

“There are 108 active #Covid-19 patients as of today in #Haryana. Death rate in Haryana is 0.79 per cent against 3.15 per cent of the country.

Tests per million of population in Haryana are 548 against all India average of 304,” he said. In another development, the Health Minister said that the State government has taken all the possible measures to check Covid-19 outbreak.

He said that Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) kits will be given to doctors and health workers, sanitation workers battling the Covid-19 outbreak in containment zone area.

Vij said, “The team of health workers engaged in survey and screening of patients will be provided PPE kits in the Containment Zone.”

Title: 24-yr-old youth involved in nexus of forging e-pass nabbed
Article:
Talaiya police have nabbed a 24-year-old youth who was involved in nexus of forging e-pass for emergency travel of people during lockdown; the nexus made over Rs 6 lakh in the past ten days by collecting hefty amount from people wanted to return home.Acting on a tip off a youth was nabbed near Tanatan Dhaba who was identified as Shailendra Lodhi who owned Samarpan Travels agency.

Shailendra revealed that Abhisek Shrivastava of Harikrishna Travels along with Deepak Joshi and Fateh Rajaoria ganged to provide people with transportation using forged e-passes at hefty prices.They made around 24 passes which were for Gurgram, Bihar, Baliya, Khandwa, Baliya, Khandwa, Muzafarnagar, Pachmari, Patna, Rewa, Samastipur and other regions. The passes were made by mentioning reasons like heart failure, deaths etc.

Shailendra would keep Rs 1000 out of Rs 3000 charged by Abhisek.Search for other accused is intensified. Fateh Rajoria and Deepak Joshi work as driver and their houses were raided but they managed to escape. Fateh earned Rs 48000 , Shailendra earned Rs 24000, Abhisek earned Rs 36000 while Deepak earned Rs 528000. Deepak charged Rs 11 per km from the people who were provided with transportation.

The four vehicles used in the fraud were Maruti Ertiga MP04CT618, Toyota Innova MP04TA7077, Mahindra Bolero MP04CV1485, Toyota Innova MP04CA8374.Fateh used to produce fake e-passes and would collect ID proof of the people who were provided transport. The nexus was revealed after a forged online emergency pass carrying six students of Bihar in a car was tracked Talaiya police.

The police personnel checked the details with the officials and found that no such permission is provided by the police and administration and detained them.

Title: Industries have started opening: Hry chief Secy
Article:
Haryana Chief Secretary, Keshni Anand Arora on Tuesday reviewed the progress of opening of industries for production and procurement of crops in a review meeting with the Deputy Commissioners of all districts of the State, officers of the Departments of Industries, Agriculture and Health along with other senior officers through video conferencing.

She said industries in the State have started opening due to which workers have started getting employment, directing the officers concerned to monitor industries. She said work has started under MGNREGA but more and more people should be provided employment and MGNREGA labourers should be engaged more in water conservation, and irrigation related tasks.

Arora said efforts should be made to provide work to the migrant labourers at locations near their workplaces and the police should be informed about their movement from one place to another once they get work. She also directed to start construction projects and brick kilns as per directions.

Additional Chief Secretary, Health and Family Welfare Department, Rajeev Arora said if any Asha worker is on duty in the containment zone then the full protection kit will be provided to them along with gloves, masks and sanitizer for the remaining duties. He said that civil surgeons can also appoint retired doctors and Paramedical staff who are up to the age of 69 on contractual basis for one year. Additional Chief Secretary, Industry and Commerce Department, T.V.S.N. Prasad directed all the Deputy Commissioners and officers of the Department of Commerce to extend all possible help to the industrialists so that they do not face any difficulty in starting their industry.

Additional Chief Secretary, Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs Department, P.K. Das said that where wheat is not being procured by the arthiyas, the concerned agencies have been directed to make direct procurement. Additional Chief Secretary, Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare Department, Sanjeev Kaushal said that the amount of commission will be sent to the account of the Panchayat or FPO who will play the role of middleman in procurement of wheat. If any person or agency applies for a license for commission, then the Deputy Commissioner can issue license to them as per rules.

Title: Ricky Kej live today for global unity, strength in tough time corona time
Article:
Ricky Kej (Grammy Award Winning Composer and environmentalist) is organizing a one-of-its-kind ‘Online music concert – Ricky Kej LIVE on One Page Spotlight this Earth Day, to leverage the global power of unity and strength during this tough time.

The event will be held on Wednesday, marking the Earth Day. It is organised with support from World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) and UNICEF. The event is also supported by Earth Day Network, UNCCD, UN Climate Change, UNESCO MGEIP, One Page Spotlight.

Sharing the thought behind the concert, Ricky Kej, said, “The idea behind Shine Your Light is to spread awareness and appreciation for the Earth's environment which serves as a conscious reminder of how fragile our planet is and how important it is to protect it. The current situation has threatened the livelihood of people, species and ecosystems.

Title: 5 new patients,11 recovered in Punjab
Article:
With five new cases reported from Rajpura town of Patiala district, including that of a doctor, Punjab’s tally reached at 251 on Tuesday. The silver lining is that during past 24 hours, as many 11 patients have recovered and discharged across the State, including five from hotspot Jawaharpur village in Mohali district and daughter of Padma Shri Covid-19 casualty Nirmal Singh Khalsa.

In late night developments, five more cases were reported positive in Jalandhar, which are yet to be included in the state’s official record. With this, the state’s tally would be 256.

Among the five fresh cases, a doctor, who was consulted by the corona-positive woman, was tested positive in Rajpura block on Monday night, besides four others, taking the total number of positive cases in Patiala district to 31.

“The Rajpura woman had visited the doctor before she was shifted to the isolation ward of Government Rajindra Hospital,” said the spokesperson. Patiala Civil Surgeon Harish Malhotra said that all five positive cases were of Anaj Mandi area of Rajpura, and all were contacts of earlier positive cases of the area. “Out of 19 samples, five tested positive. We have already contained the area and there is no need to panic,” he said.

Of the five, one is daughter-in-law of the Rajpura woman who had tested positive while three are friends of already positive patient.

“Five positive cases, which came positive, are from the same source. All are asymptotic. Same line of contact tracing,” said the Special Chief Secretary Karan Bir Singh Sidhu. A complete screening of vulnerable localities of Rajpura has been started and testing of further contacts is being done.

As per the media bulletin, Mohali remains the worst-hit district with the highest number of coronavirus cases at 62 followed by Jalandhar at 48 and Patiala at 31. Pathankot has reported 24 cases so far. Nawanshahr has shown brilliant recovery with just one active case after reporting total 19. Till date, 7355 suspected cases have been reported in Punjab, and out of these, samples of 6,769 were tested negative, while the results of 335 are awaited.

The state on Tuesday witnessed 11 patients, including six from Mohali, one from Kapurthala, two from Jalandhar, one from Ludhiana, and one from Fatehgarh Sahib, recovering from the deadly virus.

Title: PUNJAB SEEKS CENTRE’S PERMISSION TO OPEN LIQUOR SHOPS
Article:
Pointing to the state’s critical fiscal situation, Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh on Tuesday sought the Centre’s permission to allow sale of liquor, in a phased manner, to mop up VAT and excise revenue.

“Union Home Ministry should allow the State to take a conscious decision to allow the sale of liquor in certain areas in a phased manner with strict social distancing and other measures to prevent Covid-19,” he said in his letter to the Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

“This would help the State immensely in its efforts to scale up the relief and healthcare measures to combat Covid-19 and meet some, if not all, of its committed liabilities and other day-to-day expenses,” he added.

Title: Youth groups come togetther for ‘A Milk Drive’ in Bhopal
Article:
The youngsters of the city have come up together to help out the children of the city. A Milk Drive is being carried out in the city by youth groups Bhopal Helping Hands and Ansh Happiness Society for the small children.

While everyone is in their homes during lockdown, the poor and needy section of the society is suffering. Looking at this, the youngsters of the city have pulled up their socks to help them.

As the COVID-19 has a serious outbreak in the country, 21 day lockdown was announced by Government. But, in all this, the most suffered section is poor and needy people. To help them, youngsters of the city are distributing food packets and ration to the needy people.But, now they have also begun the Milk Drive for children till or under 3 years. The drive began from Sunday and till now the groups have distributed 400 milk packets in difderent areas of the city.

While informing about the initiative, Saiem Khan one of the founding members of Bhopal Helping Hands told The Pioneer that the groups are distributing milk packets every day and till now have distributed at least 400 packets.

He said that children require milk for healthy growth. Families who cannot afford this essential item for their children, we have marked them and are distributing the packets to them.

“This is our responsibility to stay safe and keep others safe. So, the volunteers take all the precautions, they wear masks and gloves. They do not handover the packets, instead they keep it outside the doors.

Besides, they change their clothes and take a bath before they enter the house,” he added.

Saiem also said that the volunteers also aware poor people about COVID 19 and tell them about the safety precautions.

Title: UT Police deploys drones to nab curfew violators
Article:
In the wake of repeated violations of the curfew clamped to stem the spread of Covid-19 in Chandigarh, the UT Police has deployed drones, as a key surveillance instrument, to identify and arrest those roaming in the city defying curfew orders.

At present, three drones are being used by the UT Police. The unmanned aerial vehicles have been pressed into service to record videos and keep a tab on people’s movement and prevent any gathering.

These drones have been deployed for surveillance after the directions of Punjab Governor and UT Administrator VP Singh Badnore. The curfew was imposed in Chandigarh on March 24 onwards to ensure social distancing and combat the spread of Covid-19.

While talking to The Pioneer, UT Superintendent of Police Roshan Lal, who is incharge of the drones surveillance said, “Three drones have been deployed in the city. While one was deployed earlier for making announcement regarding Coronavirus and asking people to ensure social distancing, two more drones have now been pressed into service for surveillance purpose.”

“The drones give us a bird’s eye view of a particular area. These drones use hexa and quad copter technologies to carry a payload of upto 5 kgs. An aerial surveillance for 20 minutes can be done in a single round from these drones. Videos are recorded and monitored by police teams. In case of any violation, the SHO concerned will take action,” the SP said.

“On Tuesday, drones were deployed in Manimajra, colony number 4, Sector 15, near Tribune colony and Sector 25 to keep a check on curfew violators,” he said.

“These drones are being used during early morning and evening hours to keep surveillance over morning or evening walkers who visit parks and other areas. During relaxation hours, social distancing norms in market areas and food distribution centres are also being monitored,” he added. SSP Nilambari Jagadale also monitored the working of drones on Tuesday.

From Delhi to Tamil Nadu, the police authorities are deploying drones to identify and take action against people violating lockdown or curfew orders amid Coronavirus pandemic.

Earlier, the Chandigarh Police had used drones for videography of impounded vehicles kept at Police Lines Sector 26, Children Traffic Park in Sector 23 and Industrial Training Institute in Sector 28.

Apart from this, the UT Administration has also deployed a drone to spray disinfectant in grain market and other areas in the union territory. This drone can cover three to four acres of area within 10 minutes.

Notably, the union territory of Chandigarh has been declared as “containment zone” to stop the spread of Coronavirus. 15 out of total 38 outer borders of the city have been closed till further orders.

Title: Punjab Health Dept issues detailed advisory for office work
Article:
To regulate and guard safety and well-being of frontline workers engaged in war against Covid-19, Punjab Health Department on Tuesday issued detailed advisory for all State Government offices asking them to install thermal scanners at entry gates wherever feasible to screen any symptoms besides a direction to encourage ‘work from home’ and mandating use of hand sanitizers and masks as must for all times.

“Only such staff, required in person for essential reasons, should be asked to attend the office. The comprehensive plan with regard to such staff who has been specifically called be drawn up which shall include sitting arrangement by keeping a minimum distance of one metre amongst the employees, flexible timings of reporting for duty, flexible timing of leaving the office, flexible timings of lunch and tea breaks in between with an objective to avoid clustering and cluttering of the staff,” said an official spokesperson.

Spokesperson said that the advisory further asks the departments to ensure availability of alcohol-based sanitizer (minimum 70 percent ethyl alcohol v/v) to be mounted at the entrance wall of the office for the staff to sanitize their hands before entering the premises besides mandating wearing of cloth masks at all times immediately from leaving the house till the entry back into the house.

In case of multi-storied offices where the elevators are to be used, sanitizers shall be mounted near entry door of elevator at each and every floor, the advisory read adding that hand sanitizing stations should be installed in office premises and near high contact surfaces.

Underlining the process to disinfect the office spaces, he said that it has been advised that indoor areas, including conference rooms, should be cleaned every evening after office hours or early in the morning before rooms are occupied.

If contact surface is visibly dirty, it should be cleaned with soap and water prior to disinfection. Prior to cleaning, the cleaner should wear disposable rubber boots, gloves (heavy duty), and a cloth mask.

Spokesperson added that all indoor areas such as entrance lobbies, corridors and staircases, escalators, elevators, security guard booths, office rooms, meeting rooms, cafeteria should be mopped with a disinfectant with one percent sodium hypochlorite or equivalent disinfectants.

Urging the employees to scrupulously adhere to health protocol, the advisory asks them to voluntarily report any symptom for early treatment besides exhorting to not indulge in gossip/rumors with regard to Covid-19 without verifying the facts.

In case an employee is diagnosed as corona positive and such an employee has attended the office, the Department shall immediately inform the helpline no 104 or State Control Room at 01722920074 or 8872090029 along with all the facts about employee and contacts he or she might have during the attendance in the office, said the spokesperson adding that the employer shall therefore maintain a complete and proper record of all employees attending the office on any particular day.

Title: 3 held for carrying 81 ltrs of liquor in garbage collection vehicle
Article:
Koh-e-Fia police have arrested three persons including driver of door –to-door Garbage collection vehicle while carrying 81 liters of country made liquor in Garbage collection vehicle at Lalghati on Tuesday.

Acting on a tip off regarding transporation of country made liquor illegally in a garbage collection vehicle it was tracked and when it was checked three sacks were recovered from the vehicle.The vehicle bearing registration number MP04LD1505 was seized by police and three persons including the driver were arrested.

The three were identified as Sonu Jateliya (22), Shankar Sirmoliya (39) and Bunty Patoliya (25) all residents of Shahjehanbad.Police said that Sonu was deployed as driver of the vehicle which was used to carry the country made liquor. A total of 546 pouches were recovered from three sacks kept inside the compartments used to collect garbage.

Police said that the nabbed accused confessed that used to sell the liquor but the source of procuring liquor is yet to be found and would be investigated in the further investigation.

The buyers of the liquor provided by the accused would be investigated in the further investigation. The police have registered a case under section 34 of the Excise Act.

The crime record of the three and their involvement in illegal transport of liquor would be investigated.Driver of the garbage collection vehicle would be investigated as it is possible that he might have transported country made liquor illegally in the past.

The driver was aware that the GPS monitoring was not done during lockdown and taking advantage transport of goods illegally was done.

Title: GOVT CUTS 25% PETROLEUM EXPENSES OF ALL, EXCEPT COVID FRONTLINE DEPTS
Article:
Virtually launching an austerity drive during the days of Covid lockdown, the Punjab government on Tuesday decided to steer clear of additional expenses by cutting down on petroleum expenses by 25 percent of all but key Covid frontline departments as interim measure, besides approving Rs 1,625.87 crore budgetary cuts of admin departments.

Punjab, in the absence of any support from the Centre, is struggling to meet Covid battle costs, and thus announced a series of cost-cutting measures including immediate 25 percent reduction in existing entitlements for petroleum product expenses of all Government departments, except Health, Medical Education, Police, Food and Agriculture.

“The reduction will remain in force till Finance Department resubmits its proposal to review vehicle entitlements, vehicle models and Petrol or Diesel limits for the Chief Minister’s consideration,” said the spokesperson after the decision was taken at a video conference meeting of Sub-Committee on Finance, chaired by the Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh.

The Chief Minister stressed the need for an exit strategy, pointing out that the State could not be kept under lockdown indefinitely. The report of the 20-member expert committee working on the strategy is expected this week.

Amid serious concerns expressed by Finance Minister Manpreet Badal over critical fiscal situation in the State in light of all revenue receipts drying up, the meeting decided that tough decisions needed to be taken, as an interim measure, to help the state tide over these difficult times.

The meeting also decided that norms and expenditure on security of people, not holding public office any longer or have never held public office, would be reviewed by May 15 to decide on possible cuts on this count.

Notably, the security of several protected persons in the State, including the Chief Minister, has already been cut down to divert police personnel to the much-needed curfew enforcement and Covid relief duties.

In another step to generate much-needed revenue for the state, all Administrative Departments in the State have been asked to deposit balances available with the Societies under them in the State Treasury by April 30, after retaining two months of operation and maintenance expenditure of the Society.

There are around 40 such societies functional in various departments, said the spokesperson.

The meeting also approved budgetary cuts or deferments, amounting to Rs 1625.87 crores, suggested by the various Administrative Departments, subject to a review again in June 2020.

A formal approval was also given to the Chief Minister’s earlier announcement that dependents or legal heirs of an employee of the State Government, who contracts Covid-19 infection in the line of duty, would be paid an ex-gratia of Rs 50 lakhs.

Meanwhile, the Chief Minister has asked the Health Department to prepare a comprehensive budget for Covid related expenditure. It was decided that Finance Department, after meeting requirements of Health and Medical Education Departments, as also the requirements of relief and rehabilitation, would provide for committed liabilities only till June 30, 2020, and the fiscal position of the State would be reviewed again in the first week of June 2020.

FIND WAYS TO BOOST TEST: CAPT

Capt Amarinder expressed concern over the inadequate number of testing kits available with the State Government, and asked the concerned departments to find ways and means of boosting the tests.

TO ENSURE COVID-FREE SMOOTH WHEAT PROCUREMENT

To ensure that the procurement process continues smoothly, without any hassle or payment delays for the farmers, it was decided that the Department of Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs would get the issues with the Central Government on various components of cost sheets resolved before the beginning of kharif marketing season 2020-21, so that no cash credit limit (CCL) gap accrues to the State.

It was decided that the Departments of Food and Civil Supplies and Agriculture would take every possible measure to ensure Covid-free smooth procurement of wheat.

The issue of stubble burning was also discussed during the Video Conference, with the Chief Minister directing all ministers to ensure strict implementation of the state government’s directives on this count, in order to check such burning.

PUNJAB TO SEEK COMPENSATION FOR REVENUE LOSS

Chief Minister Capt Amarinder directed Revenue Department to prepare a comprehensive memorandum to the Central Government for compensation of loss on account of Covid-19.

It was decided that if it was not possible to assess the complete loss to the State immediately, an interim memorandum may be submitted to the Central Government, seeking compensation for loss of State's revenue and other requirements for relief and rehabilitation for the first quarter ending June 30, 2020. Thereafter, a complete final memorandum would be sent to Centre by end June 2020.

Title: 42-year-old woman robbed by 3 miscreants including woman of valuables worth Rs 2.5 lakh
Article:
A 42-year-old woman was robbed by three miscreants including a woman of valuables worth Rs 2.5 lakh by captivating her at Narul Apartment under Koh-e-Fiza police station area; miscreants came posing as starve people due to lockdown.

The three miscreants held the victim Huma alias Sadiya Khan captive and tied her legs and hands and escaped with the valuables.

However, police suspects on the incident as no one has been spotted in the CCTV footages checked by the police.

In her complaint victim stated that she was alone at her house and talking over phon with her sister Seema when a girl and a youth came and asked for food claiming that they are hungry for the past two days and after she opened the gate the two along with one more youth entered the house tied her hands and legs and escaped with the valuables. Seema who failed to get response after hearing scream of her sister informed her brother Abdullah who rushed to the house and found that Huma was lying with mouth tied with cloth, he rescued her and informed police.

At the time of the robbery her husband Jamshed Khan has gone on work and children were at grandparents’ house near Polytechnic square. In the robbery gold jewelry and Rs 5000 cash were taken away.

The police was informed and CCTV footages were checked two hours before and after the incident but no one appeared to enter and exit the apartment. The victim claimed that girl was in the age group 15–16 while youth in the age group of 18.

Title: No new patient found on Tuesday in State
Article:
No new patient of novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) was reported by the State health department in Uttarakhand on Tuesday. The State has 46 patients of the disease so far, out of whom 19 have won the battle against the virus and have been discharged from the hospitals. On Tuesday, one more patient of the disease was discharged from the Government Doon Medical College (GDMC) hospital after his second sample was found negative for COVID-19 on the day. Incidentally 11 patients of the disease have so far been successfully treated and discharged from GDMC hospital.

The additional secretary medical health and family welfare department, Yugal Kishore Pant said efforts are being made to increase the number of samples sent for testing of COVID-19. He said that maximum numbers of samples are being sent from Dehradun district for testing.

He said that reports of 277 suspected patients were received by the department on Tuesday till 5.30 pm and all of them were found negative for the disease.

He said that reports of 570 samples are still awaited by the department. The authorities have so far taken swab samples of 4061 suspected patients for COVID-19 test.

On Tuesday, samples of 324 suspected patients were taken and sent to the lab for test. In Udham Singh Nagar samples of 144 suspected patients were taken while 91 samples were taken from Nainital district. In Dehradun 46 samples were taken by authorities while 23 samples were collected from Haridwar district.

A total of 2101 people are under institutional quarantine while 543 suspected patients are in hospital isolation in the state. The authorities have kept 63754 people under home quarantine in different parts of the state.

In Government Doon Medical College (GDMC) hospital, 11 positive patients of COVID-19 are currently admitted while eight are undergoing treatment at government medical college, Haldwani. Seven patients are admitted in Mela hospital, Haridwar and one Military Hospital (MH), Dehradun.

Pant added that 853 isolation beds are available in different COVID-19 treatment hospitals of the state. He claimed the state has sufficient stock and supply of Personal Protective (PPE) kits, N-95 and triple layer masks.

Title: Labourers killed on railway track while returning home
Article:
Two labourers who were returning home on foot due to the coronavirus lockdown, were killed after being run over by a freight train in Koriya district on Tuesday, police said.

The mishap took place around 8 am between Udalkachhar and Darritola railway stations under Mandendragarh police station limits in Koriya, they said.

As per preliminary information, the victims, Kaleshwar Rajwade (21) and Gulab Rajwade (20), along with two other workers left from Pendra-Marwahi-Gaurela district on Monday to reach their native villages in Surajpur district, located around 130 km from Pendra, by walking along the rail tracks, a police official said.

All the four men were undergoing training in manufacture of fertilizers in Pendra, but it was suspended due to the lockdown.

As no transport services are available due to travel restrictions, they decided to walk along the rail route, the official said.

After an overnight journey, they reached a spot between Udalkachhar and Darritola stations on the Anuppur-Ambikapur railway line, located around 80 km from Pendra, where the two victims sat on the track to have breakfast while the two other workers went to fetch water.

The victims failed to notice the goods train approaching towards the spot where they were sitting on the tracks and were crushed to death, the official said.

The other two workers informed the police about the incident and the bodies were sent for post mortem, he said.

An accidental death report was registered and further investigation was underway, he added.

Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel expressed grief over the death of the two workers, and instructed the district authorities concerned to provide necessary assistance to their family members immediately.

Title: RLDA issues RFQ for Doon railway station redevelopment
Article:
While various works are stuck awaiting progress due to the nation-wide lockdown to contain the COVID-19 pandemic, work on the Dehradun railway station redevelopment project has moved a step forward. The Rail Land Development Authority (RLDA), with the approval of the NITI Aayog, has issued Request For Qualification (RFQ) for the project.

The RFQ can be downloaded from the e-procurement portal www.tenderwizard.com/RLDA. The last date for receiving pre-bid query has been set at May 8 whereas the pre-bid meet is slated to be held on May 13 and 20.
